intro: Peltanthera, commonly known as the yellow pellitory, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their small, yellow flowers that are typically clustered in umbels, giving them a delicate and dainty appearance. Peltanthera species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Their leaves are usually heart-shaped and have a soft, hairy texture. The genus includes several species, with Peltanthera corymbosa being one of the most well-known.
